topic.title: HUGE list of selfhosted services / wep apps
topic.body:
I found a very long list of open source selfhosted services / web apps. Enjoy ;)
https://github.com/Kickball/awesome-selfhosted

topic.title: Is the partnership between Canonical and Microsoft a good thing ?
topic.body: Not a long time ago, Microsoft and Canonical decided to make a native Windows implementation in Ubuntu and  integrate a Linux bash in Windows 10. Is it a good thing?

topic.title: IPFS : A peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol
topic.body:
Hi everyone. i've been wandering the internet and i've found this. This is  a protocol that aims the same goals as Zeronet, decentralize the internet. It seems promising.
https://ipfs.io/

5_178NSuZP2hH2vHhNX6vsHceh5sjPkDrLiH.body: I'm worried about Microsoft. If Microsoft is trying to make himself a place in the "Linux World", with all the Windows 10 bullshit they made, i personally don't take it as a good sign.

> [assman](#comment_11_18AAv2MxpUxLjG6U64nucoBg833eTaR83u): Anything that lowers the barrier to Free Software adoption is a good thing.

Absolutely, but i don't think Microsoft would do such thing without any benefits.
